description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP) server denial of service vulnerability (CVE-2024-38068):

1. Download and apply the relevant update packages based on your system's build number.
2. Restart your system after installation to ensure the changes take effect.

**Details**:
- This update is crucial to mitigate resource consumption issues that could lead to a denial of service.
- Update packages related to this vulnerability include:
  - Windows 11 Version 23H2: KB5040442
  - Windows 11 Version 22H2: KB5040442
  - Windows 11 Version 21H2: KB5040431
  - Windows 10 for x64-based Systems: KB5040448
  - Ensure the system running Windows 10 or 11 is updated to the specified build numbers.
- For manual installation, download the update packages from the official catalog:
  - [KB5040431](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040431)
  - [KB5040448](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040448)
  - [KB5040427](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040427)
  - [KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442).
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the update installation.
